input: Invoking kmail for the first time creates a folder called Mail in your home folder. This folder contains the initial folders inbox,outbox,sent-mail,trash and drafts. Use Settings Configure kmail ... to enter some initial information so kmail will be able to properly retrieve and send your messages.

input: PGP MIME

This format is the successor of the inline OpenPGP format. If you use this format then the message text and all attachments will be signed and or encrypted at least by default. This is the recommended format if you use OpenPGP.

input: S MIME

This format is an alternative format to PGP MIME. If you use this format then the message text and all attachments will be signed and or encrypted at least by default. This format is mostly used by corporations.

input: S MIME opaque

input: Message Filters

After using kmail for a while,you may find that you have trouble sorting out the new messages in your inbox when they arrive. Filters allow you to automatically perform certain actions on incoming messages and to manually perform actions on selected messages in a folder.
target: ikoresha kmail A,Gicurasi Gushaka Ishungura Inyuma i Gishya Ubutumwa in Agasanduku k' Ibyinjiye Ryari.Ibikorwa ku Ubutumwa na Kuri N' intoki Ibikorwa ku Byahiswemo Ubutumwa in A Ububiko....

input: Please note that the filters described in this section are applied after the messages have been downloaded from your account -- if you want to filter messages on the server,see Download Filters.

Filters are considered one after the other,starting with the first filter in the list. The first one whose pattern matches the given message gets executed you can request that the remaining filters also be applied,but the default is to stop processing at the first matching filter.
target: Rimwe Nyuma i Ikindi,Itangira...in i Urutonde. Itangira Rimwe Ishusho i Ubutumwa Kubaza... i Muyunguruzi Byashyizweho,i Mburabuzi ni Kuri Guhagarara Inonosora Ku i Itangira Akayunguruzo.

input: Fast Filter Creation

When creating a filter on mailing list messages this method will try really hard to find a criterion that uniquely identifies messages from that list If it succeeds,the guessed name of the list is presented in the Message Create Filter Filter on Mailing-List... menu entry.
target: Urutonde ,Bya i Urutonde ni in i ku -... Ibikubiyemo Icyinjijwe.

input: The second method is to manually construct a filter from scratch by calling the filter dialog through Settings Configure Filters.... The filter dialog is described in detail in the following subsection.
target: ISEGONDA Uburyo ni Kuri N'Ikiganiro Gihinguranya....Ikiganiro ni in Ibisobanuro in i.

input: The Filter Dialog
This dialog allows you to manage and edit your list of filters.
target: Ikiganiro Kuri kuyobora na Kwandika Urutonde Bya Muyunguruzi.

input: You can reach it either via Message Create Filter or Settings Configure Filters....
The dialog is divided into four main sections
Available Filters
Filter Criteria

You can click on More to get an additional initially empty rule if you want to define more-complex patterns and on Fewer to remove the last rule. Clear clears the pattern,ie it removes all but two rules from screen and resets those two.
target: Kanda ku Kuri Kubona ubusa NIBA Kuri Kugaragaza... Birenzeho - ITSINDA RY' IMIBARE C Imitako na ku Kuri Gukuraho i Iheruka. i Ishusho,ie Mugaragaza na Kabiri.

input: Invalid or empty rules are not evaluated.
Filter Actions
In this group you can edit the list of actions that are applied to all messages that match the defined filter criteria. See Filter Actions below for a detailed description of each action type.

You can click on More to get a new,empty action if you want to define more than one action and on Fewer to remove the last action. Clear clears the list,ie it removes all but one action and resets that one.
target: Kanda ku Kuri Kubona A Gishya,ubusa Igikorwa NIBA Kuri Kugaragaza... Birenzeho Rimwe Igikorwa na ku Kuri Gukuraho i Iheruka Igikorwa. i Urutonde,ie Byose Rimwe Igikorwa na Rimwe.

input: Invalid or empty actions are not executed.
Advanced Options
target: Amahitamo yo mu rwego rwo hejuru

input: In this group you can define a few advanced options for filters that allow you to refine your filtering.

input: The If this filter matches,stop processing here check box in the second row controls whether or not the filters after the current filter will be applied,if the current filter matches.

Filters are automatically named unless you explicitly rename them using the Rename... button. The dialog assumes that it should continue auto-naming the filter as long as the filter name starts with lt .

input: Similarly,empty rules and actions are removed from the pattern and action list respectively,before the filter is saved.

input: Filter Optimization
It is important to know that,for example,the order of the filters has an impact on the speed of the filter process. Here are some ideas which can help you to improve the filtering
target: ni By' ingirakamaro Kuri,Urugero,i Itondekanya Bya i Muyunguruzi ku i Umuvuduko Bya i Akayunguruzo. Ifashayobora Kuri i Iyungurura

input: Stop filter processing as early as possible

If you know that a filter finally processes a certain class of messages,please make sure to check the option If this filter matches,stop processing here for the filter. This will avoid the evaluation of the filter rules of all subsequent filters. See the advanced options in the Filter Dialog.
target: Bya Ubutumwa,Ubwoko Kuri Kugenzura i Ihitamo iyi Akayunguruzo,i Akayunguruzo.Bya Byose Muyunguruzi. i Urwego rwo hejuru Amahitamo in i.

input: An example is filtering messages from mailing lists via List-Id header into separate folders. Having found out that a message came from list A means that you can avoid checking the next filter for messages from list B.
target: Intonde Biturutse - Umutwe Ububiko. Byabonetse Inyuma A Urutonde A Kugenzura... i Ibikurikira Urutonde.

input: Consider the costs of the evaluation of filter rules

Another dependency is on the amount of data which is used for the evaluation of a filter rule. If the rule is based on a message header,its evaluation should normally be much faster than the evaluation of a rule based on the complete message.
target: i Bya A Akayunguruzo. i ni ku A Ubutumwa Umutwe,i Bya A ku i Byuzuye Ubutumwa.

input: You should try to keep the filter rules as simple as possible.
Check the order of your filters
Filter Log
If you want to verify that your filters work as intended,you can open a viewer for the filter log via Tools Filter Log Viewer....

In the viewer,there you can configure the logging of the filter processing. You can control the detail level of the log,clear the log or save the log into a file. The log can provide valuable information if you need to debug your filtering process.
target: i,Inonosora. Igenzura i Ibisobanuro urwego Bya i LOG,Gusiba i LOG Cyangwa Kubika i LOG A Idosiye.NIBA Kuri Kosora amakosa Iyungurura.

input: The Anti-Spam Wizard

input: Generate Message-ID
When this is active,knode generates its own Message-IDs for all articles you post.
The Message-there would otherwise be collisions between messages with the same Message-ID and the news server would reject the second article because it thinks this article has already been received.

The English word scoring is used in many other countries,too.

input: Select All
Allen Winter
konsolekalendar is a command line interface to kde calendars.

konsolekalendar is a command line interface to kde calendars. It lets you view,insert,remove,or modify calendar events by way of the command line or from a scripting language. Additionally,konsolekalendar can create a new kde calendar,export a kde calendar to a variety of other formats,and import another kde calendar.

input: Main features of konsolekalendar
View calendar entries from a start date time to end date time
Insert add calendar entries
Remove delete calendar entries
Modify change calendar entries
Create a new calendar
Export calendar entries to other file formats

input: Import an existing kde calendar
konsolekalendar is not another graphical user interface to a kde calendar i. e. korganizer . konsolekalendar is intended solely for uses where a graphical user interface is not practical or possible.

konsolekalendar does not provide a full-featured language for making queries of the user'nor is it the intention of the authors to ever write such a capability. Primitive command line options are provided for accessing calendar events within a consecutive range of dates time stamps.

Removing Entries

konsolekalendar supports the removal of entries in a calendar file or resource using the --delete command line argument. Calendar entries to be removed are specified exactly by their Unique-string identifier UID using the --uid option. UIDs are found by first viewing the event,using the --view option.

Modifying Entries

konsolekalendar supports the modification of existing entries in a calendar file or resource using the --change command line argument. Calendar entries to be modified are specified exactly by their Unique-string identifier UID using the --uid option. UIDs are found by first viewing the event,using the --view option.

input: Importing Calendars

konsolekalendar can import an iCal or vCal calendar file into a kde calendar. All events from the calendar being imported from will be inserted,including identical events. In the next konsolekalendar release identical events will not be inserted.

konsolekalendar will reject dates specified on the command line unless they are specified according to ISO 8601 standards,YYYY-MM-DD. Where YYYY represents a four-digit year like 2003,MM represents a two-digit month 01,02,.. ,12,and DD represents a two-digit day 01,02,... ,31.

input: What is the time specification format

konsolekalendar will reject times specified on the command line unless they are specified according to ISO 8601 standards,SS. Where HH represents a two-digit hour 01,02,... ,24,MM represents a two-digit minute 01,02,.. ,60,and SS represents a two-digit second 01,02,... ,60.

kontact is the integrated solution to your personal information management PIM needs. It combines well-known kde applications like kmail ,korganizer and kaddressbook into a single interface to provide easy access to mail,scheduling,address book and other PIM functionality.

input: korganizer requires kde 3.4. It requires roughly 2MB of space in your kde system folder. Your calendars will require additional space in your home folder. Very large calendars slow down korganizer operation,therefore periodic cleanup is advisable.
korganizer needs about 5 Megabytes of memory to run,but this may vary depending on your platform and the size of your calendars.

input: kwatchgnupg is simple gnupg log viewer for the upcoming gnupg versions 1.4 and 2.0. It works as a GUI wrapper around the command line tool watchgnupg ,which listens on a socket for log lines from the gnupg backend applications. See info watchgnupg for more information about watchgnupg .
kwatchgnupg can be started from the Tools menu of both kleopatra and kmail ,as well as from the command line. The kwatchgnupg executable is named kwatchgnupg.
target: kwatchgnupg i Ibikubiyemo Bya Byombi na,i command Umurongo. kwatchgnupg ni Cyitwa.

input: Configuring kwatchgnupg
To configure kwatchgnupg ,select Settings Configure kwatchgnupg ,or the corresponding toolbar icon. kwatchgnupg 's configure dialog is divided into two parts,each of which will be described below.
target: Kugena Imiterere kwatchgnupg ,Guhitamo kwatchgnupg ,Cyangwa i Umwanyabikoresho Agashushondanga. kwatchgnupg 'S Kugena Imiterere Ikiganiro ni Kabiri,Bya munsi.

input: watchgnupg Settings

watchgnupg is the process that actually monitors the logging socket for activity and formats the lines as seen in the kwatchgnupg text view. Settings in this group are passed down to the backend using the gpgconf mechanism.
target: watchgnupg Umurimo na Imiterere i Imirongo Nka in i kwatchgnupg Umwandiko Reba. in iyi Itsinda Hasi Kuri i Impera y' inyuma ikoresha i gpgconf .

input: Executable contains the path to the watchgnupg application. If watchgnupg is in your PATH,you can keep the default watchgnupg. If watchgnupg is not in your PATH,or if you have more than one version installed,enter the absolute filename of the watchgnupg executable here.
target: Kuri i watchgnupg Porogaramu. watchgnupg ni in ,i Mburabuzi. watchgnupg ni OYA in ,Cyangwa NIBA Birenzeho Rimwe Verisiyo yakorewe iyinjizaporogaramu,Injiza i Izina ry'Bya i Bitangizwa.

input: Socket contains the socket that watchgnupg should listen on. A change here is distributed to all gnupg backend modules using gpgconf ,so you do n't need to change this setting if your gnupg config files have another log-file set.
target: ifite i watchgnupg ku. A Guhindura... ni Kuri Byose gnupg Impera y' inyuma Modire ikoresha gpgconf ,Kuri Guhindura... iyi Igenamiterere NIBA gnupg Idosiye LOG - Idosiye Gushyiraho.

input: Log Window Settings

Here,you can configure the size of the history buffer,ie the number of log lines that is kept. If more lines have been emitted by the gnupg backend since the last clearance of the history,then the oldest lines are discarded until there is enough room for the new lines again.
target: Bya i Urutonde,ie i Umubare Bya LOG Imirongo ni. Birenzeho Imirongo ku i gnupg Impera y' inyuma guhera i Iheruka Bya i Urutonde,Hanyuma i Imirongo i Gishya Imirongo Nanone.

input: You can disable the history size limit by clicking Set Unlimited. Note,however,that kwatchgnupg 's memory consumption will grow with the number of lines it currently displays. If you use an unlimited history size,then make sure to run kwatchgnupg only for short operations,or regularly clear the history manually.

cervisia provides a graphical view of CVS .
version control
revision control

a format that can be used to cause the ed editor to automatically make another copy of the old file match the new file. In the normal output format,the characters lt and gt mark the changes,and there is no context information.

Advanced Editing Tools

The Comment and Uncomment commands,available from the Tools menu allow you to add or remove comment markers to the selection,or the current line if no text is selected,if comments are supported by the format of the text you are editing.

input: Some formats define single line comment markers,some multiline markers and some both. If multiline markers are not available,commenting out a selection that does not fully include its last line is not possible.

input: If a single line marker is available,commenting single lines is preferred where applicable,as this helps to avoid problems with nested comments.
When removing comment markers,no uncommented text should be selected. When removing multiline comment markers from a selection,any whitespace outside the comment markers is ignored.

input: kate is a programmer's text editor for kde 4 and above.
This handbook documents kate Version 3.4.0

Welcome to kate ,a programmer's text editor for kde version 4 and above. Some of kate 's many features include configurable syntax highlighting for languages ranging from C and C to HTML to bash scripts,the ability to create and maintain projects,a multiple document interface MDI,and a self-contained terminal emulator.

kate comes with a flexible,configurable and capable system for doing syntax highlighting,and the standard distribution provides definitions for a wide range of programming,scripting and markup languages and other text file formats. In addition you can provide your own definitions in simple XML files.

input: How it Works

When you type in the document,the new text is analyzed and marked on the fly,so that if you delete a character that is marked as the beginning or end of a context,the style of surrounding text changes accordingly.

Highlight Detection Rules
This section describes the syntax detection rules.

Each rule can match zero or more characters at the beginning of the string they are test against. If the rule matches,the matching characters are assigned the style or attribute defined by the rule,and a rule may ask that the current context is switched.

input: Tips Tricks

Once you have understood how the context switching works it will be easy to write highlight definitions. Though you should carefully check what rule you choose in what situation. Regular expressions are very mighty,but they are slow compared to the other rules. So you may consider the following tips.

input: The Main Window

The kate Main Window is a standard kde application window,with the addition of side bars containing tool views. It has a menubar with all the common menus,and some more,and a toolbar providing access to commonly used commands.

input: The docking capabilities of the window is used for the tool windows

Editing Area

The kate editor is the editing area of the kate window. This editor is also used by kwrite ,and it can be used in konqueror for displaying text files from your local computer,or from the network.

input: Documentation copyright 2001,2002 Daniel. Naber
Regular Expressions

This Appendix contains a brief but hopefully sufficient and covering introduction to the world of regular expressions. It documents regular expressions in the form available within kate ,which is not compatible with the regular expressions of perl,nor with those of for example grep.
target: ifite A Intangiriro Kuri i Bya. Inyandiko Ibisanzwe in i muri kate ,i Bya Perl,Bya ya.

input: Say you want to search a text for paragraphs that starts with either of the names Henrik or Pernille followed by some form of the verb say.
target: UrugeroBya i Amazina Cyangwa ku IfishiBya i Ishinga.

input: With Regular Expressions,that task could be accomplished with a single search,and with a larger degree of preciseness.
target: A UMWE Shakisha,A Kinini Dogere Bya.

input: \\t0,4HenrikBARPernille saysBARid
The above example demonstrates all four major concepts of modern Regular Expressions,namely
The caret starting the expression is an assertion,being true only if the following matching string is at the start of a line.
target: Itangira... i imvugo ni,nibyo NIBA i Ikurikiranyanyuguti ni Ku i Tangira vendorShortName Bya A Umurongo.

input: The string 0,4 is a quantifier saying anywhere from 0 up to 4 of the previous.
target: Ikurikiranyanyuguti 0 S,40 S Hejuru Kuri 4 Bya i Ibanjirije.

input: All together,the expression will match where we wanted it to,and only there.
The following sections will describe in details how to construct and use patterns,character classes,assertions,quantifiers and back references,and the final section will give a few useful examples.
target: Ibyatoranyijwe in Birambuye Kuri na Koresha Imitako,Inzego,na Inyuma Indango,na i Bihera Icyiciro A Ingero.

input: Patterns consists of literal strings and character classes. Patterns may contain sub-patterns,which are patterns enclosed in parentheses.

In patterns as well as in character classes,some characters have a special meaning. To literally match any of those characters,they must be marked or escaped to let the regular expression software know that it should interpret such characters in their literal meaning.
target: Inzego,Inyuguti A Bidasanzwe Igisobanuro. BIHUYE Icyo ari cyo cyose Bya Inyuguti,cy byagarajwe Cyangwa Kuri i Ibisanzwe imvugo Inyuguti in Igisobanuro.

input: This is done by prepending the character with a backslash \\.

The regular expression software will silently ignore escaping a character that does not have any special meaning in the context,so escaping for example a j \\j is safe. If you are in doubt whether a character could have a special meaning,you can therefore escape it safely.
target: OYA Icyo ari cyo cyose Bidasanzwe Igisobanuro in i Imvugiro,A j \\ j ni.A Bidasanzwe Igisobanuro,Gusohoka.

input: Escaping of course includes the backslash character itself,to literally match a such,you would write\\\\.

A character class is an expression that matches one of a defined set of characters. In Regular Expressions,character classes are defined by putting the legal characters for the class in square brackets,or by using one of the abbreviated classes described below.
target: ni imvugo Rimwe Bya A Gushyiraho Bya Inyuguti.,Inzego ku i By'in kare Udusodeko,Cyangwa ku ikoresha Rimwe Bya i Inzego munsi.

input: Simple character classes just contains one or more literal characters,for example abc matching either of the letters a,b or c or 0123456789 matching any digit.
target: Inzego ifite Rimwe Cyangwa Birenzeho Inyuguti,Bya i A,b Cyangwa C Cyangwa 0123456789 Icyo ari cyo cyose Umubarwa.

input: Because letters and digits have a logical order,a-c is equal to abc and 0-9 is equal to 0123456789. Combining these constructs,for example a-fynot1-38 is completely legal the last one would match,of course,either of a,b,c,d,e,f,y,n,o,t,1,2,3 or 8.

input: As capital letters are different characters from their non-capital equivalents,to create a caseless character class matching a or b,in any case,you need to write it aAbB.

input: These are cost attributes for functions regarding some event type. As functions can call each other,it makes sense to distinguish the cost of the function itself Self Cost and the cost including all called functions Inclusive Cost. Self is sometimes also referred to as Exclusive costs.
target: Imimaro Icyabaye Ubwoko. Imimaro Ikindi,Kuri i Ikiguzi Bya i Umumaro ' na i Ikiguzi Byose Imimaro '. 'ni Kuri Nka'.

input: An abstract item related to source code to which event counts can be attributed. Dimensions for cost entities are code location eg source line,function,data location eg accessed data type,data object,execution location eg thread,process,and tuples or triples of the aforementioned positions eg calls,object access from statement,evicted data from cache.
Event Costs
Sum of events of some event type occurring while the execution is related to some cost entity. The cost is attributed to the entity.

input: Inherited Event Type

input: The process of collecting statistical information about runtime characteristics of program runs.

A sequence of timestamped events that occurred while tracing a program run. Its size is typically linear with the execution time of the program run.

swap msgid and msgstr fields in a PO file

module kdebindings do-not-compile dcoppython end module
You can do this by simply running kdesvn-build --refresh-build module.
touch kdesvn build arts. refresh-me kdesvn-build
Set DISTRO BSD for all modules
global set-env DISTRO BSD end global
kdesvn-build --resume-from kdebase
kdesvn-build --ignore-modules extragear multimedia kdereview
Changing global options
It is also possible to change options only for a specific module.-- module,option-name value.
ssh Agent checks
Disabling the ssh agent check
global disable-agent-check true end global
Other kdesvn-build features
Color output
global colorful-output false end global
Credits And Licenses
Comes with unsermake support.

input: use-unsermake,to use the advanced unsermake build system.
This option is just like make-options but for unsermake ,which accepts some options that make cannot understand.

Set this option to true in order to use the experimental unsermake program instead of automake when running the configure script. This can lead to some serious decreases in build time,especially for distributed building systems. This option defaults to true for most modules.

input: cvscheck prints information about the status of your local CVS checkout without communicating with the server. This means it is extremely fast and does not require a network connection.

input: The given directory and all of its subdirectories will be processed recursively. If no directory is given,the current directory and its recursed subdirectories will be used.

input: Each file with an interesting status will be printed with a status character in front of its name. The status characters are as follows.
target: in Imbere Bya Izina. Imimerere Inyuguti Nka.

input: foobar. c
The file is not known to CVS
M foobar. c
The file is definitely locally modified
m foobar. c
The file might have local changes. You should diff with the server to make sure.
C foobar. c
The file has a CVS conflict and therefore cannot be committed.
U foobar. c
This file is in CVS but is missing in your local checkout.
target: Idosiye ni in CVS ni Ibuze in Bya hafi.

input: T foobar. c
This file has an unusual sticky CVS tag.
A foobar. c
You have done a cvs add for this file,but have not yet committed it.
R foobar. c
You have done a cvs rm for this file,but have not yet committed it.
This utility is part of the kde Software Development Kit.

input: We hope you enjoy umbrello and that it helps you create high quality software. umbrello is Free Software and available at no cost,the only thing we ask from you is to report any bugs,problems,or suggestions to the umbrello developers at uml-devel lists. sourceforge. bugs. kde. org.
Other Features
This chapter will briefly explain some other features umbrello offers you.
Copying objects as PNG images

About UML
UML is designed for Object Oriented software design and has limited use for other programming paradigms.

UML is composed of many model elements that represent the different parts of a software system. The UML elements are used to create diagrams,which represent a certain part,or a point of view of the system. The following types of diagrams are supported by umbrello

Class diagrams can contain several other items besides classes.

Interfaces are abstract classes which means instances can not be directly created of them. They can contain operations but no attributes. Classes can inherit from interfaces through a realisation association and instances can then be made of these diagrams.

States are the building block of State Diagrams. A State belongs to exactly one class and represents a summary of the values the attributes of a class can take. A UML State describes the internal state of an object of one particular class

input: Note that not every change in one of the attributes of an object should be represented by a State but only those changes that can significantly affect the workings of the object

input: Start and End. They are special in that there is no event that can cause an Object to return to its Start state,in the same way as there is no event that can possible take an Object out of its End state once it has reached it.

input: Activity Diagram
Activity Diagrams describe the sequence of activities in a system with the help of Activities. Activity Diagrams are a special form of State Diagrams,that only or mostly contains Activities.
target: i Ifashayobora Bya. A Bidasanzwe IfishiBya,Cyangwa ifite

input: Activity Diagrams are similar to procedural Flux Diagrams,with the difference that all Activities are clearly attached to Objects.
Activity Diagrams are always associated to a Class,an Operation or a Use Case.

Activity Diagrams support sequential as well as parallel Activities. Parallel execution is represented via Fork Wait icons,and for the Activities running in parallel,it is not important the order in which they are carried out they can be executed at the same time or one after the other
target: Gushigikira Nka Nka Biteganye. Itangiza ni Biturutse Udushushondanga,i in Biteganye,ni OYA By' ingirakamaro i Itondekanya in Inyuma Ku i Igihe Cyangwa Rimwe Nyuma i Ikindi

input: An Activity is a single step in a process. One Activity is one state in the system with internal activity and,at least,one outgoing transition. Activities can also have more than one outgoing transition if they have different conditions.

input: Activities can form hierarchies,this means that an Activity can be composed of several detail Activities,in which case the incoming and outgoing transitions should match the incoming and outgoing transitions of the detail diagram.

User Interface
umbrello 's main window is divided in three areas that will help you keep an overview of your entire system and access the different diagrams quickly while working on your model.

input: Tree View
umbrello 's User Interface
umbrello 's User Interface
umbrello 's User Interface
Tree View
New Model

You can save your model at any time by selecting the option Save from the File Menu or by clicking on the Save button from the application toolbar. If you need to save your model under a different name you can use the option Save As from the File Menu.

For your convenience umbrello also offers you the option to automatically save your work each certain time period. You can configure if you want this option as well as the time intervals in the Settings from umbrello
target: Ukubonera umbrello Kubika Akazi Igihe Igihe. umbrello

input: Load Model
Editing Models
In umbrello ,there are basically two ways for editing the elements in your model.
Edit model elements directly through the Tree View
Edit model elements through a Diagram

Once you have added elements to your model you can also edit an element by accessing its properties dialog,which you find by selecting the option Properties from the context menu shown when right clicking on the items in the Tree View.
target: ku Indangabintu Ikiganiro,ku i Ibigize in i.

input: You can also edit your model by creating or modifying elements through diagrams. More details on how to do this are given in the following sections.
target: Kwandika Urugero ku Kurema Cyangwa Ibintu Gihinguranya. Birambuye ku Kuri iyi in i Ibyatoranyijwe.

input: Your UML model consists of a set of UML elements and associations between them. However you cannot see the model directly,you use Diagrams to look at it.
target: UML Urugero Bya A Gushyiraho Bya UML Ibintu na hagati. i Urugero,Koresha Kuri Kureba Ku.

input: Creating Diagrams

To create a new diagram in your model simply select the diagram type you need from the New submenu in the Diagram menu and give a name to it. The diagram will be created and made active,and you will immediately see it in the tree view.
target: Kuri. Byaremwe na Gikora,na Ako kanya in i Igiti Reba.

input: Removing Diagrams

Should you need to remove a diagram from your model,you can do this by making it active and selecting Delete from the Diagram Menu. You can also achieve this by selecting Delete from the diagrams context menu in the Tree View

Since deleting a diagram is something serious that could cause loss of work if done by accident,umbrello will ask you to confirm the delete operation before actually removing the Diagram. Once a diagram has been deleted and the file has been saved there is no way to undo this action.
target: Gusiba A ni Bya Akazi NIBA Byakozwe ku,umbrello ask Kuri Emeza i Gusiba Igikorwa Mbere i. A Kyasibwe S na i Idosiye ni Oya Kuri Isubiranyuma iyi Igikorwa.

input: Renaming Diagrams
If you want to change the name of an existing diagram you can easily do this by selecting the Rename option from its RMB menu in the Tree View.
target: Kuri Guhindura... RMB Ibikubiyemo in i.

input: Another way to rename a diagram is to do this via its properties dialog,which you obtain by selecting Properties from its Context Menu or by double clicking on it in the Tree View.
target: Kuri Guhindura izina A ni Kuri iyi Biturutse Indangabintu Ikiganiro,Cyangwa ku MAHARAKUBIRI ku in i.

input: Deleting Elements

Editing Elements

Note that you can also select the properties option from the context menu of the elements in the Tree View. This allows you to also edit the properties for the diagrams,like setting whether the grid should be shown or not.

input: In the properties dialog for a class you can set everything,from the color it uses to the operations and attributes it has.
Class General Settings
The General Settings page of the properties dialog is self-explanatory. Here you can change the class' name,visibility,documentation,etc This page is always available.
target: Bya i Indangabintu Ikiganiro ni -. Guhindura... i Izina,Ukugaragara,Inyandiko,etc ni Buri gihe Bihari.

input: Class Attribute Settings

In the Attributes Settings page you can add,edit,or delete attributes variables of the class. You can move attributes up and down the list by pressing the arrow button on the side. This page is always available.
target: Ongera,Kwandika,Cyangwa Gusiba Ibiranga Ibihinduka Bya i Urwego. Himura Ibiranga Hejuru na Hasi i Urutonde ku i Akambi Akabuto ku i.ni Buri gihe Bihari.

input: Class Template Settings
This page allows you to add class templates which are unspecified classes or datatypes. In Java 1.5 these will be called Generics.
Class Associations Page
This page is only available if you open the Class Properties from within a diagram. If you select the class properties from the context menu in the Tree View this page is not available.
Class Display Page
Class Color Page

In the Widget Color page you can configure the colors you want for the line and the fill of the widget. This option obviously makes sense only for classes displayed in diagrams,and is missing if you open the class' properties dialog from the Tree View.

input: amor is a small animation which sits on top of your active window.

This Handbook describes kteatime ,the kde Tea Cooker.
What's kteatime

kteatime is a handy timer for steeping tea. No longer will you have to guess at how long it takes for your tea to be ready. Simply select the type of tea you have,and it will alert you when the tea is ready to drink.

ark is an archive manager for kde .

ark is a program for managing various archive formats within the kde environment. Archives can be viewed,extracted,created and modified from within ark . The program can handle various formats such as tar,gzip,bzip2,zip,rar and lha if appropriate command-line programs are installed.

kde archiving tool

ark is a program for managing various compressed file formats within kde . Archives can be viewed,extracted,created and modified with ark . The program can handle various formats such as tar,gzip,bzip2,zip,rar when the appropriate libraries or command-line programs are installed.

Query the user for an archive filename and add specified files to it. Quit when finished.
target: Bya i Kuri Ongera Idosiye Kuri.Byarangiye.

input: t,--add-to filename
Add the specified files to filename. Create archive if it does not exist. Quit when finished.

input: f,--autofilename suffix

ark -b -d archive. tar. bz2 archive2. zip

input: Result Stack

target: h na ni,ie Kuri A Umurongo

input: kgpg is a simple graphical interface for GnuPG gnupg. org.
kgpg is a simple interface for GnuPG,a powerful encryption utility. GnuPG also known as gpg is included in most distributions and should be installed on your system. gnupg. org.
With kgpg you will be able to encrypt and decrypt your files and emails,allowing much more secure communications. A mini howto on encryption with gpg is available on gnupg's web site.
target: kgpg Kuri Shyiraho Umutekano na Idosiye na,Amatumanaho.GPG ni Bihari ku Urubuga Ipaji.

input: With kgpg ,you do n't need to remember gpg's command lines and options. Almost everything can be done with a few mouse clicks.
target: kgpg ,Kuri Kwibuka command Imirongo na Amahitamo.A Imbeba.

input: Getting Started
Here is a list of kgpg 's main components
System Tray Icon
kgpg system tray applet
Key Manager Window
Key manager window

That's the central place to manage your keys. To open the Key Manager window,click with the LMB on kgpg 's applet. You can import,export,sign and edit your keys. Most actions can be performed with a RMB click on a key.
target: i Kuri kuyobora Utubuto. Gufungura i Idirishya,LMB ku kgpg 'S Applet. Kuzana,Kwohereza hanze...,Shyiraho Umukono na Kwandika Utubuto.A LMB Kanda ku A Urufunguzo.

input: Editor Window
It's a simple text editor,where you can type or paste text to encrypt decrypt it. To open the editor,click with the RMB on kgpg 's applet.
target: A Byoroheje Umwandiko Muhinduzi,Cyangwa Komeka Umwandiko Kuri Shyiraho Umutekano . Gufungura i Muhinduzi,RMB ku kgpg 'S Applet.

input: File manager integration

target: kgpg ni in konqueror .Kanda ku A Idosiye,Hitamo... Idosiye Kuri Shyiraho Umutekano A Idosiye.A LMB Kanda.

input: There are two ways to encrypt your data

your data is just encrypted with a password. Anybody who has a computer with gpg can decrypt your message if you give him her the password. To perform a symmetrical encryption,choose symmetrical encryption in the options box when asked to choose an encryption key.
target: BishunzweA Ijambobanga.GPG Ubutumwa NIBA i Ijambobanga. A Bishunzwe,Hitamo... Kuri Hitamo...Urufunguzo.

input: Key encryption is a bit more complicated you must exchange keys with your friends but safer. Remember that if you encrypt a key with someone else's key,you will not be able to decrypt it. You can only decrypt messages that have been encrypted with your public key.
target: ni A Birenzeho Utubuto Na.Urufunguzo,OYA Kuri.public Urufunguzo.

input: The kde Team
The wallet subsystem provides a convenient and secure way to manage all your passwords.

Computer users have a very large amount of data to manage,some of which is sensitive. In particular,you will typically have many passwords to manage. Remembering them is difficult,writing them down on paper or in a text file is insecure,and using tools such at PGP is tedious and inconvenient.
target: Abakoresha A Kinini Igiteranyo Bya Ibyatanzwe Kuri kuyobora,Bya ni.,Amagambo banga Kuri kuyobora. ni,Hasi ku urupapuro Cyangwa in A Umwandiko Idosiye ni,na ikoresha Ibikoresho Ku ni na.

input: kwallet saves this sensitive data for you in a strongly encrypted file,accessible by all applications,and protected with a master password that you define.
target: kwallet Idosiye,ku Byose Porogaramu,A Mugenga Ijambobanga Kugaragaza....

input: kwallet supports multiple wallets,so for the most secure operation,you should use one wallet for local passwords,and another for network passwords and form data. You can configure this behavior in the kwallet systemsettings module,however the default setting is to store everything in one wallet.
target: kwallet Igikubo,Igikorwa,Bya hafi Amagambo banga,urusobe Amagambo banga na IfishiIbyatanzwe. Kugena Imiterere iyi Imyifatire in i kwallet kcontrolcenter Modire,i Mburabuzi Igenamiterere ni Kuri in Rimwe.

input: A wallet is by default closed,which means that you must supply a password to open it. Once the wallet is opened,the contents can be accessed.

input: kchart User Interface
The menu offers all standard entries,including shortcut and toolbar configuration and page layout for printing.

Note that data editing is not available if you use kchart from within kspread because all data is provided by the spreadsheet. As a standalone application the dataeditor is an important part of the application.

input: Options - 3D Parameters
To get a 3D effect for this type of chart,go to the Bar page and simply activate 3D bar.

input: Where ever kformula gets embedded,it will behave the same.

Basic Usage

Like other koffice applications,on startup kivio presents a startup dialog. The dialog offers a choice of creating a new document,opening a saved document or choosing a document from a list of recently saved files.

input: Using Stencils

Stencils are grouped into stencil sets for organizational purposes only it is perfectly okay to add several stencil sets to a document and kivio allows you to mix and match stencils from different sets freely.
target: Impamvu ni Kuri Ongera Kuri A Inyandiko na kivio Kuri na BIHUYE Kuva.

input: To place a stencil onto the document simply drag it from the stencil area to the page.
Selecting Stencils
Moving Stencils

To move a stencil to another position on the page,select the stencil. Note the pointer will change to a hand icon. Hold down the LMB and move the mouse to the new position. Release the mouse button to place the stencil at the new position.

input: A kivio document can contain several pages of diagrams.
Adding Pages

To add additional pages to a document select Page Insert Page or click with the RMB on the page tab and select Insert Page from the context menu. The selector beneath the document view shows tabs for all the pages in the document that have not been hidden.
target: Ongera Amapaji Kuri A Inyandiko Guhitamo.Byose i Amapaji in i Inyandiko OYA Birahishe.

input: Removing Pages
Unwanted pages can be removed by selecting Page Remove Page or click with the RMB on the page tab and select Remove Page from the context menu.
Renaming Pages

The names given to each page can be adjusted by double-clicking on the page name on the page selector or by clicking with the RMB on the page tab and select Rename Page... from the context menu. A dialog box will appear allowing the name to be edited.
The order of the pages can be adjusted by dragging the tabs on the page selector bar.
The arrow buttons on the page selector bar are for scrolling through the page tabs,they do not cycle through the pages themselves.

If you have a lot of pages in a document and you do not want to see them all on the page selector you can hide pages by selecting Page Hide Page. This will remove the currently selected page from the page selector bar.
To reveal a hidden page select Page Show Page... and choose the page you want to see from the list box.

Individual pages can be exported as bitmap graphics files. To export the current page select File Export... or File Save As.... A standard kde file dialog box appears. The export format is determined by the name extension you give the file,it must end with one of the extensions listed below.

input: koffice is an integrated office suite for the K Desktop Environment kde .

kivio a flowchart application
karbon14 a vector drawing application
krita a pixel based drawing application
kchart a charts graphs generation application

input: Configuring koffice and Your System
Optimizing Font Output
How to Get Nicely Scaled Fonts on Screen

While koffice automatically can handle all X11 fonts on screen,on most systems,printing is done via ghostscript. Now,while koffice knows the font names used by X-Window ,it does normally not know the font names used by ghostscript. koffice tries to guess these names,which unfortunately does n't work all of the time.

input: Absolute Cell References

kthesaurus lists words related to a given term and offers a user interface to wordnet ,a powerful lexical reference system. By default,only the English language is supported.
target: kthesaurus Intonde Amagambo Kuri A Ijambo na A Umukoresha Imigaragarire Kuri wordnet ,A Indango Sisitemu. Mburabuzi,ni.

input: The Thesaurus Tab

The Thesaurus tab offers a small thesaurus,built from a subset of wordnet .Synonyms,More General Words hypernyms,More Specific Words hyponyms. Synonyms are words with a very similar meaning. They do not necessarily apply to all senses of each word,so you cannot always replace a word with any synonym.

input: Sometimes you want to impose quotas for certain printers. With quotas you can set upper limits for the number of pages or the amount of data to be printed over a certain period to a certain printer.
target: Mucapyi.i Umubare Bya Amapaji Cyangwa i Igiteranyo Bya Ibyatanzwe Kuri Byacapwe KURI A Igihe Kuri A Mucapyi.

input: Quotas can be set with the -o option when installing a printer with the lpadmin command,or afterwards for an already existing printer. Following are some guidelines which are missing at the time of writing in the,official CUPS documentation
target: i -gukora iyinjizaporogaramui command,Mucapyi. Ibuze Ku i Igihe Bya in i,CUPS Inyandiko

input: With CUPS you may have pagecount- and filesize-based quotas for individual printers.
Quotas are calculated for each user individually so a single set of limits applies to all users for the printer concerned.
Quotas include banner pages if those are used.
you can limit every user to 20 pages per day on an expensive printer,but you cannot limit every user except Kurt or root.
target: buri Umukoresha Kuri 20 Amapaji Umunsi ku Mucapyi,buri Umukoresha Cyangwa Imizi .

input: There are job-k-limit,job-page-limit,and job-quota-period options to give when setting up a printer.
job-quota-period sets a time interval for quota computing intervals are determined in seconds so a day is 60x60x2486.400,a week is 60x60x24x7604,800,and a month is 60x60x24x302.592.000 seconds.
target: Igice -Igice Intera in amasogonda A Umunsi ni . 400,A Icyumweru ni ,ni 2.. 000 amasogonda.

input: For quotas to be enforced,the time-period plus at least one job-limit must be set to non-zero.
target: Imigabane Kuri,i Igihe - Igihe Guteranya Ku Rimwe - Gushyiraho Kuri - Zeru.

input: The default value of 0 for job-k-limit specifies that there is no limit.
The default value of 0 for job-page-limit specifies that there is no limit.
The default value of 0 for job-quota-period specifies that the limits apply to all jobs that have been printed by a user that are still known to the system.
target: Bya 0- Igice - Igihe i Imbibi Gushyiraho Kuri Byose Ibikorwa Byacapwe ku A Umukoresha Kuri i Sisitemu.

target: Nka Byombi,Igihe - Igihe Guteranya Rimwe Cyangwa Byombi - Imbibi

input: qtcups and kups mdash The Predecessors
Both utilities are probably still widely used. For those not familiar with them,here are brief explanations.

kups was a graphical wrapper to do the administration tasks for your CUPS server,and the CUPS daemon at the heart of it. You could add,delete,modify,configure,start,and stop printers. You could cancel,delete,move,stop and restart print jobs,and you could change the settings of the daemon,start,stop,and restart it.

input: What it is not
kdeprint is not a replacement for the printing subsystem itself. kdeprint does not therefore give provision for spooling,and it does not do the basic processing of PostScript or other print data.
target: kdeprint i Icapa. kdeprint OYA ya,na OYA i Shingiro Inonosora Bya PostScript Cyangwa Ikindi Shyira ku rupapuro... Ibyatanzwe.

input: kdeprint is an intermediate layer between the spooling and the data processing print subsystem as installed,and the application that seeks to print. kdeprint provides a common interface for kde developers and kde users,to various supported print subsystems. At the same time,it is customizable,and highly configurable.

input: CUPS ,IPP,PostScript and Ghostscript
Basics About Printing
Printing is one of the more complicated chapters in IT technology.
target: ni Rimwe Bya i Birenzeho Imitwe in.

input: A new device appearing on the market required the program authors to write a new driver if they wanted their program to support it. Also for manufacturers,it was impossible to make sure their device was supported by any program known to the world although there were far fewer than today.
target: NIBA Porogaramu Kuri Gushigikira. ya,Kuri Ubwoko APAREYE ku Icyo ari cyo cyose Porogaramu Kuri i Far Bike Uyumunsi.

input: Having to support ten application programs and a dozen printers,meant a system administrator had to deal with 120 drivers. So the development of unified interfaces between programs and printers became an urgent need.
target: Kuri Gushigikira Porogaramu Porogaramu na A Mucapyi,A Sisitemu umuyobozi uyobora Kuri Na. i Bya Imigaragarire hagati Porogaramu na Mucapyi Byihutirwa.

input: The appearance of Page Description Languages,describing the graphical representation of ink and toner on sheets of paper or other output devices,like monitors,photo typesetters,etc in a common way,was a move that filled a big gap.
target: Imigaragarire Bya,i Bya na ku IMPAPURO Bya urupapuro Cyangwa Ikindi Ibisohoka Amapareye,nka,Ifoto,etc in A,A Himura Byuzuye A Umwanya.

input: One such development was PostScript by Adobe. It meant that an application programmer could concentrate on making his program generate a PostScript language description of his printable page,while printing device developers could focus on making their devices PostScript literate.
target: PostScript ku. Porogaramu ku Porogaramu A PostScript Bya Gicapika Ipaji,Icapa APAREYE igaragazarikeye ku Amapareye PostScript .

input: Of course,over time,there came the development of other description methods. The most important competitors to PostScript were PCL Print Control Language,from Hewlett-Packard ,ESC P from Epson and GDI Graphical Device Interface from Microsoft .
target: KURI Igihe,i Bya Ikindi Umwirondoro. By' ingirakamaro Kuri PostScript ,- ,Kuva na Microsoft .

input: The appearance of these page description languages made life easier,and facilitated further development for everybody. Yet the fact that there still remained different,incompatible,and competing page description languages keeps life for users,administrators,developers and manufacturers difficult enough.
target: Indimi Ubuzima,Buri wese. i FACT,S Itakorana,Abakoresha,na.

input: Rendered PostScript
example rendered as an image.

A PostScript file is a representation of one or more pages to be printed,in a relatively abstract way. Ideally,it is meant to describe the pages in a device-independent way. PostScript is not directly visible it only lives on hard disks and in RAM as a coded representation of future printouts.
target: A PostScript Idosiye ni A Bya Rimwe Cyangwa Birenzeho Amapaji Kuri Byacapwe,in A Incamake.,ni Kuri i Amapaji in A APAREYE -. PostScript ni OYA Kigaragara ku Ikomeye na in Nka A Bya.

input: Back in the early life of the Line Printer Daemon,printers were machines that hammered rows of ASCII text mechanically on to long media,folded as a zig-zag paper snake,drawn from a cardboard box beneath the table... What a difference from today
target: in i Ubuzima Bya i,Bya Umwandiko ku Kuri Birebire Ibitangazamakuru,Nka A - urupapuro,A Ikarito Agasanduku i Imbonerahamwe... A IkinyuranyoUyumunsi

input: From PostScript to Raster

Before the final raster images are put on paper cut-sheets,they have to be calculated somehow out of their abstract PostScript representation. This is a very computing-intensive process. It is called the Raster Imaging Process,more commonly RIP.
target: i Bihera AGAPANDE Ishusho Gushyira ku urupapuro Gukata - IMPAPURO,Kuri Inyuma Bya Incamake PostScript . ni A -. ni i,Birenzeho.

input: Smaller PostScript devices have a hardware- RIP built in it is etched in silicon,on a special chip. Big professional printers often have their RIP implemented as a software- RIP inside a dedicated fast UNIX run computer,often a Sun SPARC Solaris or a SGI IRIX machine.
target: PostScript Amapareye A Icyuma - in ni in,ku A Bidasanzwe. Mucapyi Nka A - Mo Imbere A Byihuta UNIX Gukoresha,A Cyangwa A SGI IRIX Imashini.

input: Ghostscript as a Software RIP
But what happens,if you are not lucky enough to have a PostScript printer available
target: NIBA OYA Kuri A PostScript Mucapyi Bihari

input: In other words,as you ca n't rely on the printer to understand and interpret the PostScript itself,the issue becomes quite a bit more complicated. You need software that tries to solve for you the issues involved.
target: Ikindi Amagambo,Nka ku i Mucapyi Kuri na i PostScript ,i Itangwa A Birenzeho.i.

input: This is exactly what the omnipresent ghostscript package is doing for many Linux ,BSD and other UNIX boxes that need to print to non-PostScript ghostscript is a PostScript interpreter,a software RIP capable of running many different devices.
target: ni i ghostscript Linux ,na Ikindi UNIX Kuri Shyira ku rupapuro... Kuri - PostScript ghostscript ni A PostScript ,A Bya Amapareye.

input: Drivers and Filters in General

Not all ghostscript filters work equally well for their printers. Yet,some of the newer ones,like the stp Filter of the Gimp Print project,produce excellent results leading to photographic quality on a par or even superior to their Microsoft Windows driver counterparts.
target: Byose ghostscript Mucapyi.,Bya i,nka i Bya i Umushinga,ibisubizo Nyobora Kuri Ubwiza ku A Ishingiro Cyangwa ATARIIGIHARWE Kuri Microsoft Windows Musomyi.

input: PostScript is what most application programs produce for printing in UNIX and Linux . Filters are the true workhorses of any printing system there. Essentially they produce the right bitmaps from any PostScript input for non-PostScript target engines.
target: PostScript Icapa in UNIX na Linux . i nibyo Bya Icyo ari cyo cyose Icapa Sisitemu.Icyo ari cyo cyose PostScript - PostScript Intego.

input: Drivers and Filters and Backends in CUPS

CUPS uses its own filters,though the filtering system is based on Ghostscript. Namely the pstoraster and the imagetoraster filters are directly derived from Ghostscript code. CUPS has reorganized and streamlined the whole mechanics of this legacy code and organized it into a few clear and distinct modules.

input: How CUPS uses the power of PPD s

PPD s were invented by Adobe to make it easy for manufacturers to implement their own features into PostScript printers,and at the same time retain a standard way of doing so. PPD s are well documented and described by Adobe. Their specification is a de-facto open standard.

kbackgammon is a graphical backgammon program for kde . It supports backgammon games with other players,games against computer engines like GNU bg and even on-line games on the First Internet Backgammon Server.
target: kbackgammon kde .Ikindi,Imikino nka GNU na ATARIIGIHARWE ku -Imikino ku i.

input: In the near future kbackgammon will allow you to play against GNU Backgammon,which is a powerful backgammon program that usually runs without a graphical frontend. It plays on FIBS with a rating of about 2000 which is quite high.
target: i kbackgammon Emera Kuri Gukina GNU ,ni A Porogaramu A.A Ipima Bya Bigyanye ni ejuru.

input: Additionally,plans are on the way that will allow games over the Internet between two kbackgammon programs and their respective users. Finally,the architecture of kbackgammon is quite open and it is possible to include support for other engines easily if you are interested in this,please contact the author.
target: ku i Emera Imikino KURI i hagati Kabiri kbackgammon Porogaramu na Abakoresha.,i Bya kbackgammon Ikindi NIBA in iyi,Umuntu i Umwanditsi.

input: How to use the Board
kbackgammon is centered around a graphical backgammon board. This board consists of the checkers,the dice,and the cube. All these game elements can be conveniently manipulated with the mouse.

input: How do I play

At the beginning of the game you get 100. You draw five cards and decide which ones you want to keep. You indicate which cards you want to keep by clicking on the face of the card. The word Held will appear above the card.

ksirtet is a clone of the well known game Tetris. You must fit the falling pieces to form full lines.
target: ksirtet ni A Bya i Game. i Kuri IfishiCyuzuye Imirongo.

input: ksirtet is a clone of the well known game Tetris. You must fit the falling pieces to form full lines. You can rotate and translate the falling piece. The game ends when no more pieces can fall,ie when your incomplete lines reach the top of the board.
target: ksirtet ni A Bya i Game. i Kuri IfishiCyuzuye Imirongo. Kuzerutsa O na translate i. Oya Birenzeho,ie Bya i.

input: Every time you have destroyed 10 lines,you advance to the next level and the pieces fall quicker to be precise,the pieces fall from the top of the screen each 1 1level second.
target: Igihe 10 Imirongo,Kuri i Ibikurikira urwego na i Kuri,Bya i Mugaragaza 1 1 urwego ISEGONDA.

input: How to Play
You can use the keyboard to rotate,translate or drop down the falling piece. The keys are configurable via the menu item Settings Configure Shortcuts....

input: Game Types

input: How to gain Points
There are two sources of points

Dropping down a piece using the Down Arrow gives a small number of points which is equal to the drop height. It is not much each time but is particularly relevant in the earlier levels,when the pieces fall more slowly.
target: Hasi A ikoresha i A Gitoya Umubare Bya Utudomo ni bingana Kuri i Ubuhagarike. ni OYA Igihe ni Byagombwa in i Intera,i Birenzeho.

input: The biggest part of the score comes from destroying full lines. It is very important to note that destroying multiple lines at the same time gives you a lot more points. A four-it gives a maximum amount of points.
target: InziraCyuzuye Imirongo. ni By' ingirakamaro Kuri Impugukirwa Igikubo Imirongo Ku i Igihe A Birenzeho Utudomo. A -A Kinini Igiteranyo Bya Utudomo.

input: The points gained are 40 for a one-liner,100 for two lines,300 for three lines and 1200 for a tetris. These numbers are multiplied by the current level. For example,destroying four lines in level 10 gives 12,000 points.
target: A Rimwe -,100Kabiri Imirongo,300A. Imibare ku i KIGEZWEHO urwego. Urugero,Imirongo in urwego 10 12,000 Utudomo.

The Regular Expression Editor Manual
regular expression
It requires that you escape certain symbols to match a star for example,you need to type \\.
It requires that you remember rules for precedence What does xBARy match a single x or a number of y,OR a number of x and y's mixed
target: x BAR Y BIHUYE A UMWE x Cyangwa A Umubare Bya Y,A Umubare Bya x na Y 'S Bivanze

input: What is a Regular Expression

You build regular expressions from smaller regular expressions,just like you build large Lego toys from smaller subparts. As in the Lego world,there are a number of basic building blocks. In the following I will describe each of these basic building blocks using a number of examples.
target: Gitoya Ibisanzwe,Gitoya. in i,A Umubare Bya Shingiro. i I Bya Shingiro ikoresha A Umubare Bya Ingero.

input: Searching for normal text.
Matching URL s
When you select something looking like a URL in kde ,then the program klipper will offer to start konqueror with the selected URL .
target: Guhitamo nka A in MukusanyaKDE,Hanyuma i Porogaramu Kuri Tangira vendorShortName i Byahiswemo.

input: Klipper does this by matching the selection against several different regular expressions,when one of the regular expressions matches,the accommodating command will be offered.
target: iyi ku i Ihitamo Ibisanzwe,Rimwe Bya i Ibisanzwe,i command.

input: The regular expression for URL s says among other things,. with a hat the character.
target: Ikindi,i Ihitamo Tangira vendorShortName .A i Inyuguti.

input: Searching for the word the,but not the re,brea the or ano the r
target: i ijambo i,OYA i,i Cyangwa i r

input: Two extra position types can be matches in the above way,namely the position at a word boundary,and the position at a non -word boundary. The positions are specified using the text \\b for word-boundary and \\B for non-word boundary
target: in i hejuru,Ku A ijambo,Ku A - ijambo. imyanya ikoresha i Umwandiko\\ b ijambo - na\\ B - ijambo

input: The four position matching regular expressions are inserted in the regular expression editor using four different positions tool
target: Ibisanzwe Byinjijwemo in i Ibisanzwe imvugo Muhinduzi ikoresha imyanya

input: Searching for either this or that

Imagine that you want to run through your document searching for either the word this or the word that. With a normal search method you could do this in two sweeps,the first time around,you would search for this,and the second time around you would search for that.
target: Kuri Gukoresha Gihinguranya Inyandiko Gushakisha...i ijambo iyi Cyangwa i ijambo. A Bisanzwe Shakisha Uburyo iyi in Kabiri,i Itangira Igihe,iyi,na i ISEGONDA Igihe Shakisha ya.

input: Using regular expression searches you would search for both in the same sweep. You do this by searching for thisBARthat,ie separating the two words with a vertical bar.
Note on each side of the vertical bar is a regular expression,so this feature is not only for searching for two different pieces of text,but for searching for two different regular expressions.
target: Umurongo ni A Ibisanzwe imvugo,Gushakisha...Kabiri Bya Umwandiko,Gushakisha...Kabiri Ibisanzwe.

input: In the regular expression editor you do not write the vertical bar yourself,but instead select the alternative tool,and insert the smaller regular expressions above each other.
target: Umurongo,Guhitamo i,na Ongeramo i Gitoya Ibisanzwe hejuru Ikindi.

input: Matching anything

Regular expressions are often compared to wildcard matching in the shell - that is the capability to specify a number of files using the asterisk. You will most likely recognize wildcard matching from the following examples
target: Kuri in i Igikonoshwa - ni i Kuri Kugaragaza A Umubare Bya Idosiye ikoresha i.i Ingero

input: cat test . res - matching every file starting with test followed by two arbitrary characters,and finally followed by the test. res
target: Igerageza . - buri Idosiye Itangira...Igerageza ku Kabiri Inyuguti,na ku i Igerageza.

input: In the regular expression editor,a repeated regular expression is created using the repeat tool
target: i Ibisanzwe imvugo Muhinduzi,A byasubiyemo Ibisanzwe imvugo ni Byaremwe ikoresha i Gusubiramo

input: Replacing amp with amp amp in a HTML document
In HTML the special character amp must be written as amp amp - this is similar to escaping in regular expressions.
target: Nka - iyi ni Kuri in Ibisanzwe.

input: This can easily be done using normal search and replace,there is,however,one glitch. Imagine that you did remember this rule - just a bit - and did it right in some places. Replacing unconditionally would result in amp amp being replaced with amp amp amp
target: Byakozwe ikoresha Bisanzwe Shakisha na Gusimbuza,ni,Rimwe. Kwibuka iyi - A -in Imyanya. Igisubizo in

input: What you really want to say is that amp should only be replaced if it is not followed by the letters amp . You can do this using regular expressions using positive lookahead.
target: Kuri ni NIBA ni OYA ku i . iyi ikoresha Ibisanzwe ikoresha Birenze Zero.

input: The regular expression,which only matches an ampersand if it is not followed by the letters amp amp amp . This is,of course,easier to read using the regular expression editor,where you would use the lookahead tools.
target: Ibisanzwe imvugo,NIBA ni OYA ku i . ni,Bya,Kuri Soma ikoresha i Ibisanzwe imvugo Muhinduzi,Koresha i Ibikoresho.

input: This chapter will tell you about how the regular expression editor works.
target: Umutwe Bigyanye i Ibisanzwe imvugo Muhinduzi.

input: The organization of the screen
The most important part of the editor is of course the editing area,this is the area where you draw your regular expression. This area is the larger gray one in the middle.
target: By' ingirakamaro Inzira s Bya i Muhinduzi ni Bya i Guhindura Umwanya,iyi ni i Umwanya Gushushanya Ibisanzwe imvugo. Umwanya ni i Kinini Ikigina Rimwe in i Hagati.

input: Above the editing area you have two Toolbars,the first one contains the editing actions - much like drawing tools in a drawing program. The second Toolbar contains the What's This button,and buttons for undo and redo.
target: i Guhindura Umwanya Kabiri,i Itangira Rimwe ifite i Guhindura Ibikorwa - nka Igishushanyo Ibikoresho in A Igishushanyo Porogaramu. ISEGONDA ifite i iyi Akabuto,Isubiranyuma na Gusubiramo.

input: Editing Tools
The text in this section expects that you have read the chapter on what a regular expression is,or have previous knowledge on this subject.
target: Umwandiko in iyi Icyiciro Soma i Umutwe ku A Ibisanzwe imvugo ni,Cyangwa Ibanjirije ku iyi Ikivugwaho.

input: All the editing tools are located in the toolbar above editing area. Each of them will be described in the following.
target: i Guhindura Ibikoresho in i Umurongo hejuru Guhindura Umwanya. Bya in i.

input: Selection Tool
The selection tool is used to mark elements for cut-and-paste and drag-and-drop. This is very similar to a selection tool in any drawing program.
target: Gukata - na - Komeka na Kurura - na -. ni Kuri A Ihitamo in Icyo ari cyo cyose Igishushanyo Porogaramu.

input: Text Tool

Using this tool you insert character ranges. Examples includes what in ASCII text says 0-9,a-zA-Z,. When inserting an item with this tool a dialog will appear,in which you specify the character ranges.
target: Ibice. in Umwandiko 0 S - 9,A - -,.iyi A Ikiganiro Kugaragara,Ibice.

input: See description of repeated regular expressions.
Any Character Tool
This is the regular expression dot .. It matches any single character.
target: ni i Ibisanzwe imvugo Akadomo .. Icyo ari cyo cyose UMWE Inyuguti.

input: Repeat Tool

This is the repeated elements. This includes what in ASCII syntax is represented using an asterix ,a plus ,a question mark ,and ranges 3,5. When you insert an item using this tool,a dialog will appear asking for the number of times to repeat.
target: ni i byasubiyemo Ibintu. in ni ikoresha ,A Guteranya ,A Ikibazo Ikimenyetso ,na Ibice 3,5. Ongeramo Ikintu ikoresha iyi,i Umubare Bya Times Kuri Gusubiramo.

input: You specify what to repeat by drawing the repeated content inside the box which this tool inserts.

Repeated elements can both be built from the outside in and the inside out. That is you can first draw what to be repeated,select it and use the repeat tool to repeat it. Alternatively you can first insert the repeat element,and draw what is to be repeated inside it.
target: i Hanze in na i Mo Imbere Inyuma. ni Itangira Gushushanya Kuri byasubiyemo,Guhitamo na Koresha i Gusubiramo Kuri Gusubiramo. Itangira Ongeramo i Gusubiramo Ikigize,na Gushushanya ni Kuri byasubiyemo Mo Imbere.

input: See description on the repeated regular expressions.
Alternative Tool
This is the alternative regular expression BAR. You specify the alternatives by drawing each alternative on top of each other inside the box that this tool inserts.
target: ni i Ibisanzwe imvugo BAR.Bya Ikindi Mo Imbere i Agasanduku iyi.

input: See description on alternative regular expressions

The compound tool does not represent any regular expressions. It is used to group other sub parts together in a box,which easily can be collapsed to only its title. This can be seen in the right part of the screen dump above.
target: OYA Icyo ari cyo cyose Ibisanzwe. ni Byakoreshejwe Kuri Itsinda Ikindi in A Agasanduku,Kuri Umutwe.Inzira s Bya i Mugaragaza hejuru.

input: Line Start End Tools
The line start and line end tools matches the start of the line,and the end of the line respectively. The regular expression in the screen dump above thus matches lines only matches spaces.
target: Tangira vendorShortName Impera Ibikoresho i Tangira vendorShortName Bya i Umurongo,na i Impera Bya i Umurongo. Ibisanzwe imvugo in i Mugaragaza hejuru Imirongo Imyanya.

input: The boundary tools matches a word boundary respectively a non-word boundary. The regular expression in the screen dump thus matches any words starting with the. The word the itself is,however,not matched.
target: Ibikoresho A ijambo A - ijambo. Ibisanzwe imvugo in i Mugaragaza Icyo ari cyo cyose Amagambo Itangira...i. ijambo i ni,OYA.

input: See description of boundary regular expressions.
The look ahead tools either specify a positive or negative regular expression to match. The match is,however,not part of the total match.
target: Kureba Ibikoresho Kugaragaza A Birenze Zero Cyangwa Munsi ya Zero Ibisanzwe imvugo Kuri BIHUYE. BIHUYE ni,OYA Inzira s Bya i Igiteranyo S BIHUYE.

input: You are only allowed to place lookaheads at the end of the regular expressions. The Regular Expression Editor widget does not enforce this.
target: Kuri Ku i Impera Bya i Ibisanzwe. OYA iyi.

input: See description of look ahead regular expressions.
User Defined Regular Expressions

Located at the left of the editing area is a list box containing user defined regular expressions. Some regular expressions are pre-installed with your kde installation,while others you can save yourself.
target: Bya i Guhindura Umwanya ni A Urutonde Agasanduku Umukoresha Ibisanzwe. Ibisanzwe Byahawe imiterere mbere -MukusanyaKDE iyinjizaporogaramu,Kubika.

input: These regular expression serves two purposes see detailed description,namely 1 to offer you a set of building block and 2 to make common regular expressions prettier.
target: Ibisanzwe imvugo Kabiri Impamvu Umwirondoro,1 Kuri A Gushyiraho Bya Funga na 2 Kuri Ubwoko Ibisanzwe.

input: You can save your own regular expressions by right clicking the mouse button in the editing area,and choosing Save Regular Expression.
target: i Imbeba Akabuto in i Guhindura Umwanya,na Kubika
